intro: Borreria laevis var. sintenisii, commonly known as the silky borreria, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important species. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Borreria laevis var. sintenisii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
